learnings.title: Personal Brand and Credibility Signals
learnings.bodyMd:
# Personal Brand and Credibility Signals

## Overview
Consistent signals—expertise, reliability, benevolence—shape your reputation over time.

## Key Concepts
- Content: case studies, talks, and open work.
- Reliability: response SLAs and follow‑through.
- Benevolence: help first, fair dealing.

## Examples
- Publish short, specific wins with metrics.
- Maintain a public changelog for commitments.

## Common Pitfalls
- Overclaiming or vague self‑promotion.
- Inconsistent responsiveness.

## Summary
Show, don’t tell. Make credibility observable through artifacts and consistent behaviors.

learnings.title: Monitoring and Listening Systems
learnings.bodyMd:
# Monitoring and Listening Systems

## Overview
Set up lightweight monitoring to catch issues and opportunities to engage early.

## Key Concepts
- Alerts: mentions, reviews, community forums.
- Feedback loops: surveys, NPS, support tags.
- Response playbooks: triage and ownership.

## Examples
- Weekly scan of mentions and reviews with a response log.
- Tag themes in support tickets to spot patterns.

## Common Pitfalls
- Reactive, ad‑hoc responses.
- Ignoring low‑signal feedback that aggregates.

## Summary
Proactively listen and categorize signals. Respond consistently with an owner and a standard playbook.

learnings.title: Crisis Response and Narrative Control
learnings.bodyMd:
# Crisis Response and Narrative Control

## Overview
In crises, respond fast with facts, ownership, and a clear remedy plan to contain reputation damage.

## Key Concepts
- Golden hour: respond within the first cycle.
- Facts, not spin: verified information only.
- Remedy: mitigation, compensation, prevention.

## Examples
- Incident post with timeline, impact, fixes, and next steps.
- Single spokesperson and Q&A doc.

## Common Pitfalls
- Silence that invites speculation.
- Overpromising fixes.

## Summary
Act quickly and transparently. Share verified facts, own responsibility, and outline concrete remedies and follow‑ups.

learnings.title: Consistency Across Channels
learnings.bodyMd:
# Consistency Across Channels

## Overview
Maintain coherent messages and tone across email, chat, social, and press to avoid confusion and erosion of trust.

## Key Concepts
- Message house: core narrative and proof points.
- Tone guidelines per channel.
- Approval workflows for public posts.

## Examples
- Message house doc shared with the team.
- Short approvals for sensitive external comms.

## Common Pitfalls
- Contradictory claims across teams.
- Off‑brand tone in public replies.

## Summary
Align on a message house and tone guide. Review sensitive comms to keep signals consistent everywhere.

learnings.title: Repair and Apology Patterns
learnings.bodyMd:
# Repair and Apology Patterns

## Overview
When you err, a good apology and concrete repair plan can strengthen trust.

## Key Concepts
- Acknowledge impact; no defensiveness.
- Specific apology; no hedging.
- Remedy and verification plan.

## Examples
- Public post acknowledging issue with steps and dates.
- Direct outreach to affected stakeholders with make‑goods.

## Common Pitfalls
- "We’re sorry if you felt…" non‑apologies.
- Vague promises without dates.

## Summary
Own the mistake, specify remedies, and verify outcomes. Close the loop with stakeholders to rebuild confidence.
